author: Gautam S Mengle
text:
Former Deputy Chief Minister and NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal, who was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate on money-laundering charges, told interrogators on Wednesday evening that he was “feeling unwell”, after which a team of doctors from the JJ Hospital was sent to examine him.

Officials said 68-year-old Bhujbal made the claim after an intense day-long grilling session during which he was confronted with the evidence the agency gathered against him. Mr. Bhujbal was arrested on Monday after being questioned for nearly 11 hours by the ED in connection with routing of money, allegedly received as kickbacks, in exchange for awarding government contracts to select contractors as PWD Minister.

The former Deputy CM was arrested by ED on money-laundering charges
title: After day-long grilling, Bhujbal says he is unwell
